intro: Jacquemontia parviflora var. oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxacan false cucumber, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing or climbing habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically borne in clusters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in warm, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or disturbed soils.
